meanings.definition: Scatter (seed) on the ground for growing.
meanings.sent1: She sown the seeds carefully in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The farmer sown the fields with wheat last spring.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel sown acorns all over the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her words sown the seeds of doubt in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rain sown life into the parched earth.

meanings.sent1: The fields were sown with corn last month.
meanings.sent2: Having sown the seeds, she waited for them to sprout.
meanings.sent3: The chef had sown the ingredients for a delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: His kindness had sown goodwill among his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The music sown a sense of peace in the room.

meanings.sent1: They sown the flower seeds in neat rows in the garden.
meanings.sent2: After they sown the vegetable seeds, they watered the soil.
meanings.sent3: The children sown seeds in the shape of a heart for fun.
meanings.sent4: His actions sown the seeds of change in the community.
meanings.sent5: The teacher sown knowledge in the minds of her students.
